NNG.name: General Noun
NNG.description: Common nouns that refer to things, people, or concepts.

NNP.name: Proper Noun
NNP.description: Proper names for people, places, or organizations.

NNB.name: Bound Noun
NNB.description: Nouns that cannot stand alone and require modifiers.

NNBC.name: Counter Noun
NNBC.description: Nouns used to count objects (e.g. 개, 명, 권).

NP.name: Pronoun
NP.description: Words like I, you, he, she, etc.

VX.name: Auxiliary Verb
VX.description: Verbs used to support main verbs (e.g. 하다, 되다).

MAG.name: General Adverb
MAG.description: Adverbs modifying verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs.

MAJ.name: Conjunctive Adverb
MAJ.description: Adverbs that connect phrases or sentences.

IC.name: Interjection
IC.description: Exclamations or filler words (e.g. 아, 어머, 와).

JKC.name: Complement Particle
JKC.description: Used before verbs like 되다 or 이다.

JC.name: Conjunctive Particle
JC.description: Joins two words or phrases (와/과, 하고).

EP.name: Pre-Final Ending
EP.description: Attached to verb stems to show tense, mood, etc.

EC.name: Connective Ending
EC.description: Links two clauses (e.g. 고, 서, 니까).

ETM.name: Modifier Ending
ETM.description: Makes a verb/adjective into an adjective phrase.

XSV.name: Verb Suffix
XSV.description: Attaches after a stem to make a verb.

XSA.name: Adjective Suffix
XSA.description: Attaches after a stem to make an adjective.

XR.name: Root
XR.description: Lexical root form used to derive other words.

SF.name: Punctuation (Sentence Final)
SF.description: Period, question mark, exclamation mark, etc.

UNA.name: Unknown Alphabet
UNA.description: Unclassified alphabetic sequence (non-standard or foreign symbols).

UNKNOWN.name: Unknown
UNKNOWN.description: Unrecognized token or unknown part of speech.
